title: Int’l bodies acknowledging improving economic situation of Pakistan: Ali Nawaz Awan
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 10 (APP):Special Assistant to the Prime Minister on Capital Development Authority (CDA) Ali Nawaz Awan Friday said the country’s economic situation was improving and various international organizations had also reported the same.
Talking to media here outside the Parliament, he said the time Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) came into power, the economic situation was very bad.
He said the government was aware about the people’s problems due to inflation, adding that efforts were underway to provide maximum relief to the people.
He expressed the hope that people would get relief with the Rs 7 billion subsidy announced by the government for the utility stores corporation.
